questions.question_text: What related list in the formula indicator record is used to navigate to the indicators used in the formula or to their indicator sources?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B

The related list in the formula indicator record used to navigate to the indicators used in the formula or to their indicator sources is B. Contributing Indicators. This list provides a direct link to the indicators that comprise the formula, enabling easy access for review or modification.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is Real Time Update. I encourage you to take a look also in a PDI, accessing Library > Data Visualizations and checking in a Single Score data visualization. In the Update Data tab one can clearly see the toggle "Real Time Update"
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-now-intelligence/page/use/dashboards/task/configure-ac-db-settings.html

Selected Answer: C
Real time update

For a single score visualization to update the score in real-time, the data update setting you can enable is "Real-time update". This option allows the score to update in real time, providing the most current score without the need for manual refreshes. It's important to note that real-time score updating does not support dot-walking with MIN, MAX, or COUNT DISTINCT aggregations .




C

questions.question_text: What data update settings can you enable for a single score visualisation to update the score in real-time?
Which of the following items can you view without the pa_viewer role if the indicator and breakdown ACLs are respected? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
If the indicator and breakdown Access Control Lists (ACLs) are respected, items that you can view without the pa_viewer role are:

B. KPI Details
C. Analytics Hub

These components are designed to provide users with insights into specific KPIs and overall analytics without necessarily requiring the pa_viewer role, as long as access permissions defined by ACLs are met, ensuring users can access relevant data while maintaining data security and governance.

questions.question_text: Which of the following styling options is NOT available with the data visualisation component configuration in workspaces?

discussion.content:
Among the options provided, the styling option that is NOT available with the data visualization component configuration in workspaces is:

D. Create a new visualization type with predefined styling.

The workspace visualization configuration allows for a variety of styling options, including sorting categories and setting color options, but creating a new visualization type with predefined styling would require more extensive development beyond simple configuration changes.

choices.A: Sort on categories in bar, pie, and donut visualisations based on table data sources.
choices.D: Create a new visualisation type with predefined styling.
choices.B: Set default, palette, or single colour options for data display.
choices.C: Change score sizes of single score visualisations.

choices.B: Set a review date on which to consider updating the target.
choices.A: Set the improvement as a percentage.
choices.D: Set a start date in the future.
choices.C: Set the threshold as an improvement on the average score.

questions.question_text: Which of the following can you do when you set a target for an indicator on the Analytics Hub? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
When you set a target for an indicator on the Analytics Hub, you can:

A. Set the improvement as a percentage. This allows you to define the target in terms of a percentage improvement over current or baseline scores, providing a clear goal for improvement efforts.

B. Set a review date on which to consider updating the target. Establishing a review date helps ensure that targets remain relevant and aligned with organizational goals and can be adjusted as needed based on performance or changes in strategic direction.

D. Set a start date in the future. This enables planning for future targets, allowing organizations to align their improvement efforts with upcoming initiatives or strategies, ensuring that targets are timely and relevant.

Which of the following can you do when you set a target for an indicator on the Analytics Hub? (Choose three.)

A. Set the improvement as a percentage.
B. Set a review date on which to consider updating the target.
C. Set the threshold as an improvement on the average score.
D. Set a start date in the future.
